reviewText: Here is a collection of 22 episodes of the great Betty Boop and made more awesome by Legend Film's colorization!She is cute, fabulously funny and I loved the fact here is a DVD I could watch with my teenage nieces who immediately fell in love with Betty! Bravo Legend Films and Betty!!
summary: The immortal funny lady is back!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Love these old cartoons from the Fleischer studios, and this collection really stands out from the other public domain copies available. Betty's over the edge cartoon antics are always outrageously funny, sometimes a little weird and creepy even hallucinatory. Here is a listing:1. Kerr-Choo2. Crazy Inventions3. Is my Palm Read4. In Blunderland5. Rise to Fame6. Poor Cinderella (color)7. Baby be Good8. Taking the Blame9. Stop That Noise10. Swat the Fly11. No! No! A Thousand Times No!12. A Little Soap & Water13. A Language All My Own14. Betty Boop & Grampy15. Judge for a Day16. Making Stars17. Henry the Funniest Living American18. Little Nobody19. The Little King20. Not Now21. Little Jimmy22. We Did ItExtras include two bonus Fleischer shorts:1. My Merry Oldsmobile2. Finding his VoiceNone of the opening titles or the cartoons themselves appear cropped in any way, I played them all and the quality was consistently nice throughout. They are a little grey at times but always watchable, sometimes absolutely vibrant and clear. Disc is single sided and has duel layer encoding (it's a DVD9). These really have undergone some amount of restoration. I doubt if better copies are available on DVD anywhere else.
summary: Legend Films Betty Boop Uncensored Vol. 1

reviewText: Stay away from this release. It's nothing more more than the Republic Films Laser disc release from the the 1990's. A total Bootleg copy. Evan worse the end titles are edited out. And a heavy handed DVNR is used and the cartoons look awful. STAY AWAY! Until an official release is issued. Big Disappointment!

reviewText: I currently own the original Echo Bridge setBetty Boop (Two-Disc Collector's Edition) (1935)with 42 cartoons on one double-sided DVD10 and a second, single-sided DVD5.  (What you get from Echo Bridge today is the 27 cartoons from disk 1 unforgivably squashed onto a single-sided DVD5, plus the original disk 2.)  Until now, this set (the original release, anyway) was considered the best single commercial collection of Betty Boop cartoons in North America.This Legend DVD, along with Legend's Betty Boop Volume 2Betty Boop Volume 2includes all the same cartoons, plus the two missing PD cartoons "Whoops! I'm a Cowboy" and "On With the New", plus two additional Fleischer rarities per disk.  I have yet to see either Legend disk, but if the (currently few) reviews are true, these two DVD's are now the ones to beat.  The cartoons are also in chronological order.  It's a shame they couldn't have included "Yip Yip Yippy" (1939) or tracked-down prints of the rare "Lost Kitten" (1938) or "Buzzy Boop" (1938), but it's still a step up, particularly for anyone who doesn't already own the Echo Bridge set.My question: for anybody who does have both sets: is the video quality really that much better?  Legend tends to release high quality material, so I am cautiously optimistic.  I'll be finding out for myself in the near future.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I hadn't seen Ms. Boop in years, so I hoped this would bring back some of the enjoyment I experienced years ago watching her cartoons as a kid. (If you must know, that era was a lot closer to her 1930s origins than to the present day.) All I can say there is that she hasn't aged well, at least not in my eyes.Irrespective of content, I would have hoped for a better transfer. The cartoons themselves show some great detail in the background art, not all of which is easily legible in this collection. And, somewhat maddeningly, it preserves flaws in the original film that could have been post-processed out - in particular, the tendency for overall light levels to rise and fall, due to irregularities in the original film and procesing. Cripes, even amateurs have tools that could level such things out. I would have expected better when I pay money for a video.In any case, Betty still is who she ever was, even thoguh the world has changed quite drastically around her.-- wiredweird
